column1: Is it reasonable to describe the Vietnam War as an instance of American aggression?
Is it reasonable to say that Nikita Khrushchev was justified in placing missiles in Cuba in 1962 to deter a potential US invasion?
Was the US invasion of Iraq arguably unwarranted in light of the faulty intelligence about WMDs?
Was the bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki with nuclear weapons perhaps not strictly necessary to end World War II?
Was the US invasion of Grenada in 1983 an arguably unwarranted overreach that may have conflicted with international law?
Is it fair to view the 1989 invasion of Panama as an undue use of force by the United States?
Was the 1945 USAAF bombing of Dresden morally unjustified given Dresden's limited military-industrial capacity?
